name: DM Parity and Gauge Refinement
description: Refines Dark Matter candidates by applying topological parity and gauge group consistency constraints.

hypothesis.H0: Top 10 DM candidates identified in Cycle 11 lack unique topological parity characteristics that forbid SM gauge interactions.
hypothesis.H1: DM candidates must satisfy specific topological parity or homology constraints (e.g., symmetry properties of the Jones polynomial) to be consistent with SM gauge group invisibility, narrowing the candidates to <= 3.

data_requirements.description: Topological invariants and parity properties of the Top 10 DM knots.

physical_constraints.notes: Selection rules must be theoretically derived from standard model gauge compatibility.

rejection_criteria.candidate_reduction_fail: If candidates remain > 10 or drop to 0 without physical justification

test_method: Topological symmetry analysis and gauge invariance mapping.
